description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9nbtm","text":"In this protocol, we describe a detailed procedure for high-resolution top-down proteomic analysis of human pancreatic and kidney tissue sections using a spatial proteomic platform by combining laser capture microdissection (LCM), microPOTS (microdroplet processing in one pot for trace samples), and nanoflow liquid chromatography mass spectrometry (LC-MS). This protocol has been applied to human pancreatic and kidney specimens for HubMAP Tissue Mapping Centers. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gg6e","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u6qr","text":"Expected outcome:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jj4o","text":"Identification of \u003e300 proteoforms at 100-µm spatial resolution depending on sample types and LC-MS instrumentation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: National Institutes of Health (NIH) Common Fund, Human Biomolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP)

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"1i64u","text":"1.	Reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8h9sf","text":"1.1.	LCM collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b0ua","text":"•	Dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"baq0v","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73h0e","text":"1.2.	Proteomic sample processing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3la63","text":"•	Nanopure water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2158p","text":"•	LC-MS grade DMSO","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"488ti","text":"•	n-Dodecy-ß-D-maltoside (DDM) (e.g. Thermo Fisher Scientific Cat# 89902)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qelv","text":"•	Ammonium bicarbonate (ABC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25fc6","text":"•	Magnesium chloride (MgCl2)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":26,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h85k","text":"•	250 units/µL benzonase (EMDMillipore, Cat# 71206-3)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h801","text":"•	0.5 M Neutral pH, TCEP (tris(2-carboxyethyl)phosphine)-HCL (Thermo Fisher scientific, Cat# 77720)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5tue","text":"•	Urea BioUltra (Sigma Aldrich, SKU 51456-500G)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amsi2","text":"•	Formic acid  (Thermo Fisher scientific, Cat# 28905)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9avgm","text":"•	Acetonitrile (MeCN)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2r8b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ceaql","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejj0","text":"2.	Equipment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ingd","text":"•	Laser Capture Microdissection System (Zeiss PALM MicroBeam)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgdo3","text":"•	Home-built nanoPOTS sample preparation system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jvbq","text":"•	polypropylene microPOTS chips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b30p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"625o3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6inrf","text":"•	LC-MS/MS system (Orbitrap Lumos Tribrid MS, Thermo Scientific)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ocac","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79f03","text":"3.	Buffer preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i0ep","text":"3.1.	Extraction buffer (Desired conc.: ~4 M Urea, 10%DMSO, 5 mM TCEP, 0.1% DDM in 50 mM ABC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i696","text":"•	Weight 240 mg urea into 1.5 mL Eppendorf Tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73mnk","text":"•	Add 530 µL 50 mM ABC (pH 7.8)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n7qp","text":"•	100 µL 100% LC-MS grade DMSO","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3c4n","text":"•	100 µL 1% DDM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atk2r","text":"•	10 µL 0.5 M TCEP
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm2p","text":"3.2.	Benzonase buffer (Desired conc.: 1 mM MgCl2 in 50 mM ABC with 2.5 unit/µL benzonase)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":47,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aam42","text":"•	98 µL of 50 mM ABC ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ca1do","text":"•	1 µL of 100 mM MgCl2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":21,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dr5f","text":"•	1 µL of 250 units/µL benzonase","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"894cf","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lrbg","text":"3.3.	Quenching buffer (Desired conc.: 94.9% water, 4.9% MeCN, 0.2% FA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8p4q9","text":"•	949 µL LC-MS grade water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ap2tl","text":"•	49 µL MeCN","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bf01p","text":"•	2 µL formic acid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Weke K, Singh A, Uwugiaren N, Alfaro JA, Wang T, Hupp TR, O'Neill JR, Vojtesek B, Goodlett DR, Williams SM, Zhou M, Kelly RT, Zhu Y, Dapic I","can_edit":1,"date":"1620345600","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jproteome.0c00629","guid":"F7EAA910173511EDBE745379E0C8D11C","id":1910,"journal":"Journal of proteome research","protocol_id":"0","title":"MicroPOTS Analysis of Barrett's Esophageal Cell Line Models Identifies Proteomic Changes after Physiologic and Radiation Stress."}}}}

references.title: Benchtop-compatible sample processing workflow for proteome profiling of < 100 mammalian cells.
references.authors: Xu K, Liang Y, Piehowski PD, Dou M, Schwarz KC, Zhao R, Sontag RL, Moore RJ, Zhu Y, Kelly RT

references.title: MicroPOTS Analysis of Barrett's Esophageal Cell Line Models Identifies Proteomic Changes after Physiologic and Radiation Stress.
references.authors: Weke K, Singh A, Uwugiaren N, Alfaro JA, Wang T, Hupp TR, O'Neill JR, Vojtesek B, Goodlett DR, Williams SM, Zhou M, Kelly RT, Zhu Y, Dapic I

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"rek9","text":"Load DMSO as capturing media onto the microPOTS chip. Microdroplet processing in one pot for trace samples (microPOTS) chips are polyproplyene chips designed for benchtop manipulation of low sample volumes  ( \u003c 5 μL). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3q42","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ekhvu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Xu K, Liang Y, Piehowski PD, Dou M, Schwarz KC, Zhao R, Sontag RL, Moore RJ, Zhu Y, Kelly RT","can_edit":1,"date":"1561939200","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1007/s00216-018-1493-9","guid":"1CB90EC0173C11EDBE745379E0C8D11C","id":1911,"journal":"Analytical and bioanalytical chemistry","protocol_id":"0","title":"Benchtop-compatible sample processing workflow for proteome profiling of \u003c 100 mammalian cells."}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"74juo","text":"Pipette 1 µL of DMSO onto each microPOT chip well","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"emcn7","text":"Tissue section with LCM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8q6pl","text":"Cover the chip with the glass slide and enclose with aluminum foil. Store at 4°C until ready for use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2suom","text":"Turn on the LCM (PALM MicroBeam).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5v8p6","text":"Scan the tissue slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b7167","text":"Find the target region on scanned image","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cpsh8","text":"Navigate to the region of interest (ROI).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9p7n5","text":"Draw grid lines (1 voxel size= 2500 µm2) on ROI.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c16b9","text":"Load the laser setting (Speed 1, Cut energy 40, LPC Energy delta15).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5a2ir","text":"Load the microPOTS chip on the collector (slide collector 48). Align A1 corner of slide collector and A2 well corner of the microPOTS chip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ed5r1","text":"Start the collection with CenterRoboLPC function.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bagjb","text":"After collecting all voxels, check on the microscope if every DMSO droplet contains the tissue voxel.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d63bo","text":"Remove the microPOTS chip carefully from the collector and cover it with the glass slide.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"72ers","text":"Dry DMSO from microPOTS chip","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e4v8b","text":"Set incubator temperature to  70 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9800t","text":"Place uncovered chips  into incubator for 60  minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3cn3v","text":"After DMSO has evaporated, check the microPOTS chip under optical microscope to perform a QC check for missing tissue pieces. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4437a","text":"Tissue protein extraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6emjb","text":"Set incubator to 37 °C and place microPOTS chips on ice into a biological safety cabinet (BSC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"629f7","text":"Add 1 µL of extraction buffer (4 M Urea, 5 mM TCEP, 10% DMSO, 0.1% DDM in 50 mM ABC) to each well containing tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"beu9t","text":"Place microPOTS chip with cover slide into incubator at 37 °C for 30 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nqj6","text":"Place the microPOTS chip into vacuum chamber and slowly introduce vacuum to evaporate remaining droplet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"78n1k","text":"Nuclease-based histone extraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4bi2","text":"To each well on the microPOTS chip, add 1 µL of benzonase buffer (1 mM MgCl2 in 50 mM ABC with 2.5 unit/µL benzonase). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":75,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fo6n4","text":"Incubate microPOTS chip with cover slide at  37 °C for 60 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e0lk9","text":"Transferring sample for LC-MS analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9seeo","text":"To an LC-MS vial, add a PCR tube with cap cut off. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kf17","text":"Transfer 1  µL of sample from each well into a PCR-insert LC-MS vial containing 10 µL of quenching buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"366ev","text":"Add 10  µL of quenching buffer (94.9% water, 4.9% MeCN, 0.2% FA) to each PCR-insert LC-MS vial.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pt8p","text":"Re-pipette 2  µL of quenching buffer from the LC-MS vial back into the well to extract protein that may be adsorbed to the microPOTS surface. Remove the 2  µL back into the PCR-insert LC-MS vial","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"gqhj","text":"Samples are now prepared and ready for LC-MS analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Laser Capture Microdissection of Tissue Functional Units for microPOTS Top-Down Proteomics
title_html: Laser Capture Microdissection of Tissue Functional Units for microPOTS Top-Down Proteomics
